dsa_helpers.ml.segformer_semantic_segmentation package

Submodules

dsa_helpers.ml.segformer_semantic_segmentation.inference module

dsa_helpers.ml.segformer_semantic_segmentation.inference.inference(img: ndarray, model: SegformerForSemanticSegmentation, device: str | None = None, tile_size: int = 512, temp_dir: str = '.temp', batch_size: int = 8) → tuple[ndarray, list[ndarray]][source]

Inference on an image using SegFormer model for semantic segmentation.

Parameters:

  • img (numpy.ndarray) – Image to segment.

  • model (transformers.models.segformer.modeling_segformer.SegformerForSemanticSegmentation) – Pre-trained model.

  • device (str | None) – Device to use. Defaults to None, in which case it is inferred based on devices available.

  • tile_size (int) – Size of the tiles. Defaults to 512.

  • temp_dir (str) – Temporary directory to save tiles. Defaults to “.temp”.

  • batch_size (int) – Batch size. Defaults to 8.

Returns:

The predicted label mask and

the contours of the mask.

Return type:

tuple[numpy.ndarray, list[numpy.ndarray]]
